Package Game

Class BoxSprite

java.lang.Object
Game.Sprite
Game.BoxSprite
class BoxSprite extends Sprite
BoxSprite is a subclass of Sprite that represents the actual boxes made up by the Dot Sprites and ConnectionSprites.

The BoxSprite contains references to the four ConnectionSprites which make up its borders. The `isBoxed` method returns `true` when all four of the border ConnectionSprites have `true` `connectionMade` fields. BoxSprites should be created using the static `createBox` method.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoxSprite

      public BoxSprite()
      Constructs a new BoxSprite object. Initializes the fields and sets the color to black.

  • Method Details

    • isBoxed

      public boolean isBoxed()
      Checks if the BoxSprite is fully boxed. Returns true if all four border ConnectionSprites have true connectionMade fields, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      True if the BoxSprite is fully boxed, false otherwise.

    • createBox

      public static BoxSprite createBox(int x, int y, ConnectionSprite[] horizontalConnections, ConnectionSprite[] verticalConnections)
      Creates a new BoxSprite with the specified coordinates and border ConnectionSprites.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the BoxSprite.
      y - The y-coordinate of the BoxSprite.
      horizontalConnections - The ConnectionSprites that are the top and bottom borders of the box.
      verticalConnections - The ConnectionSprites that are the left and right borders of the box.
      Returns:
      The created BoxSprite object.
